alert.note: Alert for Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; South Central Utah; Zion National Park (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 18 at 9:30PM MST until January 20 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THURSDAY TO 5 PM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches with locally higher amounts across high terrain areas. In Zion National Park, 1 to 2 inches expected below 4000 feet elevation, otherwise 3 to 6 inches above 4000 feet elevation. * WHERE...Zion National Park, South Central Utah and Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity. * WHEN...From 11 AM Thursday to 5 PM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Periods of winter driving conditions will occur. For those planning to recreate in the backcountry, prepare for cold, snowy and wintry conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial 511.
